hc.admission.description: Represents a patient admission record linked to an encounter, capturing admission and discharge timestamps, assigned bed, and discharge disposition.

hc.appointment.description: The appointment table records scheduled healthcare encounters, linking patients, facilities, departments, and optionally providers with start/end times and status indicators.

hc.bed.description: Represents a bed within a hospital room, including its active status.

hc.charge_item.description: Represents individual billing charge items linked to patient encounters.

hc.claim.description: Represents an insurance claim submitted for a patient’s encounter, linking to the patient, the health plan, and the specific encounter, and recording billing and payment amounts.

hc.claim_line.description: Represents a line item within a healthcare claim, detailing billed, allowed, and paid amounts, and any denial reason.

hc.department.description: A table describing individual departments within a healthcare facility, including the department’s unique ID, the facility it belongs to, its name, and type.

hc.diagnosis.description: This table stores diagnoses associated with patient encounters, including ICD‑10 codes, descriptions, and the type of diagnosis, and tracks which provider recorded each diagnosis.

hc.employee.description: Represents employee records linking a person to a facility, including employment details.

hc.encounter.description: Represents individual patient encounters within a healthcare facility, including timing, provider, and disposition details.

hc.facility.description: A record of a facility linked to an organization, storing its name, type, and location details.

hc.imaging_order.description: Imaging_order records the orders placed for medical imaging procedures linked to a specific patient encounter, including the imaging modality, target body part, ordering provider, and order status.

hc.imaging_report.description: Stores radiology imaging reports linked to imaging orders, including findings, impressions, and the reporting radiologist.

hc.inventory_balance.description: Represents the on-hand quantity and reorder threshold for each item at a specific inventory location.

hc.inventory_location.description: Represents inventory location records linked to a facility and optional department, with a unique identifier and descriptive name.

hc.inventory_txn.description: Records inventory transactions, linking location, item, transaction type, quantity, and time, optionally associated with an encounter.

hc.item.description: Represents individual items in a catalog, each linked to a vendor, with SKU, name, category, and unit cost information.

hc.lab_order.description: A table storing laboratory orders linked to patient encounters, including the ordering provider, test details, timestamp, and status.

hc.lab_result.description: Represents individual laboratory test results linked to a lab order, including test values, units, reference ranges, and abnormality flags.

hc.med_admin.description: Records of medication administrations linked to orders, including who administered, when, and dosage.

hc.med_order.description: Represents a medication order issued during a patient encounter, including dosage, route, and schedule information.

hc.org.description: Table storing organization records with an ID, name, type, and creation timestamp.

hc.patient.description: Table storing patient-level information, linking to a person record and tracking medical record number, death time, and record creation.

hc.patient_insurance.description: Table stores insurance coverage information for patients, linking each patient to an insurance plan and recording coverage period and primary status.

hc.payer.description: Represents a payer entity with an ID, name, and type.

hc.payment.description: Represents payments made for insurance claims, including the amount, payment method, and timestamp.

hc.person.description: Represents an individual with basic demographic and contact information.

hc.plan.description: The hc.plan table stores information about insurance plans, linking each plan to a specific payer via payer_id.

hc.procedure_event.description: Records procedures performed during patient encounters, linking each event to an encounter, provider, CPT code, and timestamp.

hc.provider.description: Represents healthcare providers linked to employee records, storing provider identifiers, NPI numbers, and specialties.

hc.referral.description: Table storing medical referral records linking patients, referring providers, and target departments, with the reason for referral and timestamp of creation.

hc.room.description: Represents individual rooms associated with a department.

hc.vendor.description: Represents a vendor entity with a unique identifier and a name.

hc.vital_sign.description: Table storing vital sign measurements taken during a patient encounter.

hc.allergy.description: Table storing allergy identifiers and their associated substances.

hc.api_key.description: Stores API key information for application users, including hash, creation, expiration, and revocation timestamps.

hc.app_user.description: Table storing authentication credentials for application users, linking to personal details if available.

hc.appointment_note.description: A record of notes entered for a specific appointment, optionally authored by a staff member.

hc.audit_log.description: A table that records audit events, capturing when an action occurred, who performed it, what action was taken on which entity, and additional details.

hc.bed_assignment.description: Records assignment of a bed to a patient admission, including timestamps for assignment and unassignment.

hc.care_plan.description: Represents a care plan associated with a patient, optionally linked to a specific encounter and created by a provider.

hc.care_plan_goal.description: A goal linked to a care plan, detailing the objective text, optional target date, and current status.

hc.care_plan_intervention.description: Table storing individual interventions linked to a specific care plan, including description, frequency, and status.

hc.care_team.description: Represents a care team associated with a patient.

hc.care_team_member.description: This table represents the association of individuals to a care team, identifying whether each member is a provider or staff and specifying their role within the team.

hc.clinical_note.description: Stores clinical notes associated with patient encounters, including author information, note type, and the note content.

hc.device.description: Table storing information about individual devices.

hc.device_assignment.description: Records assignments of medical devices to patients or encounters, including timestamps for assignment and unassignment.

hc.device_reading.description: A table storing individual measurements or readings collected from medical devices, linked optionally to a patient, encounter, or device record.

hc.diagnosis_note_link.description: Links clinical notes to diagnoses, representing an association between a diagnostic record and its corresponding clinical note.

hc.diet_order.description: Stores dietary orders placed for patients during specific encounters, including the ordering provider, order timestamp, diet type, and optional notes.

hc.discharge.description: A record of patient discharges, linked to an admission and capturing the time of discharge, disposition, and a summary of the event.

hc.document.description: Stores documents that may be linked to a patient, a facility, or an uploading user, along with the document type, title, and upload timestamp.

hc.document_share.description: Records when a document is shared with a user or provider, including the sharing timestamp and an optional note.

hc.document_tag.description: Associates documents with tags via a many-to-many relationship.

hc.document_version.description: Stores metadata for each version of a document, including its storage location, checksum, and creation timestamp.

hc.encounter_diagnosis.description: Represents the association between a patient encounter and its diagnoses, indicating the order of diagnoses and whether each was present upon admission.

hc.encounter_document.description: Associates medical encounters with related documents, serving as a join table.

hc.encounter_location.description: Represents the location details of a healthcare encounter, linking it to specific rooms and beds over time.

hc.encounter_procedure.description: Associates a procedure with a patient encounter, recording when it was performed and who performed it.

hc.formulary.description: Represents the association between a facility and medications in its formulary, indicating whether each medication is currently active.

hc.imaging_result.description: Represents the outcome of an imaging procedure, including findings and impression.

hc.imaging_study.description: Table listing imaging study types with a unique ID, code, name, and modality.

hc.immunization.description: Stores patient immunization records, including vaccine administered, date, and facility details.

hc.insurance_plan.description: Table storing basic attributes of health insurance plans, including an identifier, payer name, plan name, and type.

hc.inventory_item.description: Represents an individual inventory item, identified by a unique ID, with a SKU, name, type, and unit of measure.

hc.inventory_stock.description: The inventory_stock table records the quantity of each inventory item at a specific location.

hc.invoice.description: Represents a billing invoice for a patient, optionally linked to a specific encounter, including issuance time, status, and total amount.

hc.isolation_precaution.description: Tracks isolation precautions applied to a patient during a specific encounter.

hc.lab_order_item.description: Represents individual tests or panels included in a laboratory order.

hc.lab_panel.description: Represents a laboratory test panel identified by a unique ID, code, and name.

hc.lab_panel_item.description: Links individual laboratory tests to a laboratory panel, representing a many-to-many relationship.

hc.lab_result_flag.description: Stores status indicators or flags associated with individual laboratory results.

hc.lab_test.description: Table containing reference ranges and units for laboratory tests.

hc.med_order_dose.description: Table stores individual dose details for a medication order, including amount, unit, frequency, and start/end timestamps.

hc.medication.description: Table containing basic medication records with identifiers for name, form, and strength.

hc.medication_form.description: Represents the different forms a medication can be administered in, such as tablet, capsule, injection, or liquid.

hc.medication_route.description: Table stores unique identifiers for medication administration routes and their names.

hc.medication_strength.description: Contains textual representations of medication strengths.

hc.message.description: Stores individual messages that belong to a message thread, including the sender (user, provider, or staff), the timestamp, and message body.

hc.message_participant.description: Represents a participant in a message thread, linking to app users, providers, or staff.

hc.message_read_receipt.description: Records when a user has read a specific message, linking messages to app users and timestamps.

hc.message_thread.description: Represents a thread of messages associated with a patient or a specific encounter, including subject and creation timestamp.

hc.note_section.description: Represents a section or category within a note, identified by an ID, code, and descriptive name.

hc.note_section_entry.description: Stores individual entries that belong to a specific section of a clinical note.

hc.note_type.description: Represents categories or types of notes, each identified by a unique ID, code, and descriptive name.

hc.patient_address.description: Represents address records associated with a patient, including an indicator for the primary address.

hc.patient_allergy.description: Represents the association between a patient and an allergy, including reaction details, severity, and the timestamp the record was created.

hc.patient_contact.description: Stores contact information for patients, including names, relationships, phone numbers, emails, and emergency status.

hc.patient_identifier.description: Table for storing various identifiers associated with a patient, such as national IDs, insurance numbers, or other unique IDs.

hc.permission.description: A table storing permission definitions, each identified by a unique ID, a name, and an optional description.

hc.problem_list.description: Represents a list of medical problems or conditions associated with patients, optionally linked to a formal diagnosis.

hc.procedure.description: A table of clinical procedures, storing a unique ID, the code system, the code, and a textual description.

hc.provider_license.description: Stores licensing details for healthcare providers, referencing the provider table.

hc.referral_document.description: Associates documents with referral records in a many-to-many relationship.

hc.referral_reason.description: Stores reasons for a referral, optionally linked to a diagnosis.

hc.referral_status_history.description: A log of status changes for referral records, capturing when and by whom each status change occurred.

hc.revenue_code.description: Represents individual revenue codes used to classify income or billing entries.

hc.role.description: Represents a role or permission level within the system.

hc.role_permission.description: Associates roles with permissions, defining which permissions belong to each role.

hc.staff.description: Represents staff members assigned to facilities and departments within a health‑care system, including role and employment status.

hc.staff_schedule.description: Represents scheduled work shifts for staff members, including start and end times and a shift classification.

hc.tag.description: A simple lookup table for tag identifiers and their names, used to classify or label other data elements within the system.

hc.transfer.description: Records the transfer of a patient admission between departments within the healthcare system.

hc.user_role.description: Links users to their roles within the system.

hc.vaccine.description: Table containing basic information about vaccines, including unique identifier, name, and manufacturer.

hc.vital_type.description: Represents the various types of vital signs that can be recorded.
